title: CO- by US Chamber of Commerce

items.title: YouTube AI Tools for Targeted Ads and Sales
items.summary:
- YouTube uses *Google's AI investments* to offer **AI-powered tools** that tailor ads to relevant *peak moments* for higher recall and conversions. 
- Tools enable formats like **Video Reach**, **Video View campaigns**, and **Demand Gen** to optimize for awareness, engagement, and purchases across mobile and TV. 
- Experts say AI-driven formats streamline planning and require multi-format creatives to keep brands competitive on YouTube’s vast reach.

items.title: How Small Businesses Can Grow With the App-Based Economy
items.summary:
- App-based platforms like Uber, DoorDash, and Instacart let small businesses *reach more customers*, scale operations, and thrive in a flexible economy.
- Industry data shows *massive growth potential*, with billions in economic impact and a digital payments market projected to surge in the coming years.
- To capitalize, pursue platform partnerships, study case studies, and use the *three-sided marketplace* and built-in AI tools to expand reach and streamline operations.

items.title: New Hire Paperwork Checklist for Small Businesses
items.summary: - The guide lists essential hiring paperwork (W-4/W-9, I-9, state tax forms, benefits, direct deposit, internal agreements) and explains federal vs state requirements for compliant onboarding. - It advises assembling an onboarding packet with policies, offer letters, payroll and benefits forms, and a welcome package, plus tools for onboarding software, document storage, e-signatures, and compliance. - It emphasizes gathering emergency contact data and ensuring forms are completed before the first day, while using self-service and automation to stay organized.

items.title: How to Use Substack to Build Your Business
items.summary:
- *Substack* is a newsletter platform that helps you diversify from social apps and avoids algorithm dependence.
- It supports building a loyal *audience* with community moderation and full editorial control, plus paid content options.
- You can grow your *brand* and generate revenue through paid subscriptions, affiliate links, and sponsorships while maintaining autonomy.

items.title: Foster a Brand Community With These Tools
items.summary:
- The article highlights 10 tools and strategies to build and manage a **brand community**, including Substack, Forj, Circle, and loyalty apps.
- It discusses the **community flywheel** model with five steps and cites McKinsey data showing >4% conversion and >75% **user-generated content**, with Drunk Elephant and Gymshark as examples.
- It covers **social engagement tools** (Sprout Social, Sprinklr, Hootsuite) and tips to foster engagement and loyalty across channels.

items.title: What Is the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator?
items.summary:
- The *MBTI* identifies 16 types across four traits (E/I, S/N, T/F, J/P) to help teams understand differences and communication.
- When used properly, *MBTI* can improve collaboration and inclusion, but critics note limited *reliability* and fixed categories.
- It’s best used alongside other assessments such as *DISC*, *Big Five* (OCEAN), or CliftonStrengths rather than as the sole basis for decision-making.

items.title: Templates for Your Small Business Newsletter
items.summary:
- *Templates* save time and boost engagement by providing mobile‑friendly, customizable designs you can reuse across campaigns.
- It outlines **five core templates** (welcome, promotions, event invites, informational newsletters, celebrations) and how to tailor content with dynamic blocks for different industries.
- It lists platforms like Mailchimp, BEE, Litmus, Moosend, Campaign Monitor offering ready‑to‑edit templates to simplify your setup.

items.title: Local Business Organizations for Small Business Owners
items.summary:
- Local business organizations like *Chambers of Commerce*, *SCORE*, *Entrepreneurs’ Organization*, *1 Million Cups*, *Small Business Development Centers*, *BNI*, and *Kiwanis* help you network, gain mentors, and refine your pitch to grow your business.
- Choose groups based on your needs (**mentorship** vs **referrals**), schedule (**weekly** vs **monthly**), and format (**in-person** or **online**) to fit your routine.
- Maximize value by showing up consistently, giving referrals, using member resources, and setting measurable goals to track **ROI**.

items.title: Whatnot Livestreams Boost Small-Biz Sales
items.summary:
- Whatnot is a fast-growing *livestream shopping* platform that started with Funko Pop! and now hosts collectibles and fashion, helping *small businesses* boost sales via live shows and a trusted community.
- *Livestream commerce* was about **$128B** in 2024 and could reach **$2.4T** by 2033; in the U.S., millions will shop this way.
- Its *community-first* approach, loyalty rewards, and simple logistics (one-click labels) foster buyer-seller trust and strong top-seller income.

items.title: How to Start an eBay Store: A Guide for New Sellers
items.summary:
- Decide what to sell: start with a narrow *niche* to build authority and differentiate your *store*, then expand.
- Register as a business seller, understand *tax* obligations, and choose a memorable store name to set up your account.
- Create high-quality listings with multiple photos, optimized descriptions, smart *pricing*, and a scalable *fulfillment* plan while tracking fees.

items.title: Tools to Help You Visualize and Plan Your Cash Flow
items.summary:
- The article reviews five cash-flow tools—*QuickBooks*, *Pulse*, *PlanGuru*, *Float*, and *Cash Flow Frog*—that help visualize and plan cash flow with forecasting, integrations, and ease of use.
- It stresses that cash flow is a crucial health metric beyond the bank balance and suggests forecasting, scenario planning, and trial periods to fit your needs and budget.
- Each tool has different pricing and trial options; try free trials when available and consult professionals for personalized guidance.

items.title: Free Personality Tests for Entrepreneurs
How Floral Disruptor BloomNation Grew to $250 Million by Partnering with Small Businesses
How to Stay Community-Focused
How to Start a Business on eBay
items.summary:
- Find a high-demand, *low-competition product* by researching trends on eBay and evaluating *margins* to ensure profitability.
- Lay the groundwork: *register your business*, open a *dedicated bank account*, choose the right *eBay Store tier*, and craft professional, optimized listings that sell.
- Use tools like *Terapeak*, *Seller Hub*, and *ShipStation* to manage inventory, orders, and promotions, boosting visibility and efficiency for sustainable growth.

items.title: What Is an SOP? and How to Create One
items.summary: *An SOP (Standard Operating Procedure)* outlines detailed instructions for business functions, enhancing *organization* and *consistency*. // It is crucial for tasks that are routine, complex, or regulated, and helps maintain *work culture* across growth. // To create effective SOPs, identify needs, choose suitable formats, include comprehensive steps, and regularly update as your business evolves.*

items.title: How Corporate-Owned Locations Boost Operations
items.summary:
*Corporate-owned locations* enable companies to accelerate innovation and operational control. 
*Re-Bath* uses this model to serve as pilot sites, improve decision-making, and expand product offerings. 
This approach also enhances *training*, drives *growth opportunities*, and strengthens *brand consistency* across markets.

items.title: Top Free Online Classes for Managers
items.summary: - The piece profiles five free manager courses covering *conflict resolution*, *communication*, and *leadership*.\n- Courses include Coursera's *Conflict Resolution Skills*, Harvard's Exercising Leadership, Coursera's *Fundamentals of Management*, Alison's *Communication Skills*, and HubSpot's *Grow Your Training Skills*.\n- It explains free-to-audit options vs paid certificates and offers tips on choosing a course by urgency, industry, and schedule.

items.title: Culture + Code Formula: Freedom Forever
items.summary: - Culture is the first operating system, with servant leadership and 14% ownership aligning decisions to accelerate solar adoption and fight climate change.\n- Lightspeed is an in-house, solar-specific operating system that keeps operations agile and scalable, not relying on off-the-shelf software.\n- Raya, the AI assistant, cuts soft costs by over 5% and aims to save up to 20% of total costs, empowering people to focus on high-impact work.

items.title: Fast Track to $1M: Milex Auto Care Strategies
items.summary:
- *Transparency* with customers by recommending only necessary services builds *trust* and encourages *loyalty*.
- Owners Melissa and Grant highlight the importance of *owning mistakes* and *over-explaining* to keep customers informed, increasing *repeat business*.
- Community engagement through sponsorships, giveback programs, and creating a *family-like atmosphere* fosters *long-term growth* and *word-of-mouth referrals*.

items.title: How to Find a Foreign Distributor for Your Product
From Farmers’ Markets to $50M Sales: Ithaca Hummus Success
items.summary:
*Ithaca Hummus* grew from a local farmers' market staple to a $50 million brand sold in 10,000 stores, driven by *quality*, *authentic marketing*, and *strategic partnerships*.
- Founder Chris Kirby emphasized *passion* and *consumer needs*, leveraging *social media* to identify trends.
- The brand maintains its authenticity by *refusing shortcuts* and continuously *evolving* to meet customer expectations, framing hummus as part of a broader *culinary adventure.*

items.title: CO—100 Small Business Forum 2025: Communications Toolkit
items.summary:
- *Join* the CO—100 Small Business Forum on October 8 at the U.S. Chamber of Commerce in Washington, D.C., or virtually, celebrating the *top small businesses* in America.
- The event features *expert insights, a live Q&A with Daymond John,* and networking opportunities, with *virtual attendance is free*.
- Use the provided *graphics and social media templates* to promote and share the event, boosting *engagement* and *awareness* for small business growth.

items.title: Wayfair CTO on AI’s Game-Changing Potential
items.summary:
- Wayfair is using *AI* tools such as *Muse*, Discover, and Image Search to reimagine *product discovery* and turn decorating ideas into purchasable items.
- The Discover tab and *Image Search* drive engagement and higher *conversion rates*, letting shoppers save images and shop visually similar products.
- Analysts say Wayfair’s AI initiatives, including *CastleGate* logistics integration, are contributing to revenue growth and market-share gains in a competitive home-retail landscape.

items.title: Scaling Startups: Customer Acquisition Strategies
10 Questions to Tell if You’re Offering Top-Notch Service
items.summary:
*Assess your customer service quality with a quick quiz.*
- It covers key areas like response times, loyalty programs, and handling negative reviews.
- The quiz provides insights on how improvements can boost *business growth* and *customer satisfaction*.

**Scores:** {"scale":7,"impact":8,"novelty":6,"longTermSignificance":8}

items.title: Quiz: Small Business Social Media Strategy
items.summary:
*This quiz tests your knowledge of *social media planning, content strategies, and metrics.*
- It highlights the importance of a *solid strategy* for connecting with your audience and achieving business goals.
- Key topics include platform selection, content mix (80/20 rule), tracking tools, automation benefits, and ROI calculation.*

items.title: The Impact of Technology on U.S. Small Businesses: 2025 Report
items.summary:
*Small businesses are widely adopting advanced technologies like AI and digital payments, with almost all using some tech platform.*
- *AI usage has doubled since 2023, mainly for customer engagement and inventory management.*
- *Future tech adoption is high, with 96% planning to implement emerging tools like AR, crypto, and automation, emphasizing the need for clear policies and support.*

items.title: 'Quiet Cracking' and Employee Discontent
items.summary:
*Quiet cracking* is a rising issue in workplaces, characterized by persistent *unhappiness* that can lead to *disengagement* and *reduced productivity*.
- Unlike *burnout*, it may not show dramatic signs, making it harder to detect but equally damaging.
- Factors like *job insecurity*, *poor management*, and lack of recognition drive this trend, impacting small businesses' *growth* and *employee retention*.

**Keywords:** employee wellbeing, workplace trends, productivity, management, burnout, small business

items.title: Quiz: Are You Business-Ready?
items.summary:
- The quiz helps entrepreneurs assess their *preparedness* for launching a new business.
- It covers essential topics like legal steps, branding, financial setup, and common pitfalls.
- Taking this 10-question quiz can guide aspiring business owners on the *next steps* toward successful launch and growth.

items.title: L’Oréal Exec on Turning a Seasonal Business Into a Year-Round Staple With Its 'Got Milk?'-Inspired Sunscreen Campaign
How Brands Are Using Reddit to Drive Business
items.summary:
*Reddit's* topic-driven communities and targeted engagement are boosting business for brands of all sizes.
- With over 110 million daily users and a 2025 ad revenue growth forecast of 30.9%, companies like Jack Daniel’s and Tree Amigos are leveraging Reddit through influencers, informative content, and targeted ads.
- Small businesses, such as Tree Amigos, find success in organic posting and expertise, while startups like Alchemy Streaming see high ROI from paid ads, emphasizing Reddit’s effectiveness for niche marketing and community engagement.

items.title: How to Stop Workplace Gossip
items.summary:
*Workplace gossip is common but can harm *trust, *morale*, and *company culture*. 
- Gossip mainly revolves around *performance* and *personal lives*, often occurring in shared spaces.
- To reduce gossip, leaders should *model* appropriate behavior, promote *clear communication*, and establish *gossip policies* to foster a positive environment.

items.title: Celebrity-Owned Startup MOSH Opens a New Niche
items.summary:
- *MOSH*, founded by Maria Shriver and Patrick Schwarzenegger, targets *cognitive health* with protein bars that appeal to women.
- The company's sales have skyrocketed over 70% annually, reaching $12 million in 2024, leveraging *functional foods* and *nootropics* trend.
- Its success is driven by a focus on *taste*, *texture*, and a social mission supporting *brain health research*, especially for women.

**Scores:** {"scale": 8, "impact": 7, "novelty": 8, "longTermSignificance": 7}
**Keywords:** [celebrity, functional foods, cognitive health, protein bars, women, nootropics, market growth]

items.title: Getty Images Uses AI to Boost SMB Visual Content
items.summary:
*Getty Images leverages AI-powered tools and an extensive visual library to help small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) meet soaring content demands.*
- AI enables rapid, personalized, and legally safe visual content creation for social media and marketing.
- Getty’s proprietary library and AI tools aim to differentiate amid rising competition, ensuring quality and legal protection.

*Key points emphasize Getty’s strategy to make visual content creation safer, faster, and more tailored for SMB success.*

items.title: How to Restrict Digital Access When an Employee Leaves
items.summary:
- *Ensure proper offboarding* by maintaining *centralized and up-to-date records* of employee access.
- *Automate access revocation* immediately when an employee departs to prevent security risks.
- Consider *software solutions* designed for small businesses to streamline permissions management and enhance security.

**Impact:** 7
**Severity:** 6
**Novelty:** 4
**LongTermSignificance:** 7

items.title: Make the Most of Career Detours: Moran CEO
items.summary:
- **Embrace change** to pivot around setbacks and uncover opportunities, not roadblocks.
- **Perseverance**, **self-belief**, and purposeful risk-taking fuel leadership and business growth.
- **Emotional awareness** and **ownership** help you manage thoughts, lead with clarity, and scale your business.

items.title: Make the Most of Career Detours, Just Like the CEO of Moran Family of Brands
items.summary:
*Barbara Moran-Goodrich*, CEO of Moran Family of Brands, shares how to turn career setbacks into opportunities for growth.  
- Key strategies include *embracing change*, *perseverance*, and *self-belief*.  
- She emphasizes the importance of *emotional awareness*, *purposeful risk-taking*, and *owning your business* for long-term success.  

**Scores:** {"scale":8, "impact":7, "novelty":6, "longTermSignificance":9}

items.title: Key Lessons From the Field: How a UGA Football Star Built a Successful Multi-Brand Restaurant Portfolio
A Small Business Guide to Tap to Pay
items.summary:
- *NFC technology* powers tap-to-pay systems like Apple Pay and Google Pay for **quick, secure transactions**.
- Small businesses can easily adopt NFC payments using **existing POS systems or small card readers**.
- Top tools include **Square, Shopify, Clover**, and **PayPal Zettle**, enabling contactless payments with minimal setup.

**Scores:** {"scale": 7, "impact": 6, "novelty": 4, "longTermSignificance": 8}

items.title: How CAULIPOWER Became a $100M Frozen Food Brand
items.summary:
- *Gail Becker* transformed her lack of food industry experience into a thriving frozen food brand, *CAULIPOWER*, reaching $100 million in under five years.
- She identified a **market gap** for convenient, premade cauliflower pizza crust and leveraged her marketing skills to build a **buzzy brand** with clever messaging.
- Despite challenges like the COVID-19 pandemic, CAULIPOWER's **innovation**, agility, and strategic advice from Becker fueled its rapid growth and resilience.

items.title: How AI is Leveling the Beauty Industry Playing Field for Small Brands
Busy Baby’s Global Growth Amid Tariffs
items.summary:
*Busy Baby pivoted during tariff shocks by expanding internationally and reengineering logistics.*
- The company turned supply chain challenges into growth opportunities in markets like South Korea, Australia, and Europe.
- Its adaptability, community engagement, and premium product upgrades helped sustain long-term success.*

items.title: The Top Benefits of a Small Business Consultant
Banks vs. Credit Unions: Key Differences
items.summary:
*Banks are for-profit institutions owned by shareholders, offering extensive services and advanced technology.*

*Credit unions are not-for-profit, member-owned, often providing lower rates and personalized service.*

*Choosing between them depends on your business needs, such as service variety, digital tools, or community focus.*

items.title: How Successful Entrepreneurs Manage Time
items.summary:
- *Successful entrepreneurs* use systems like the **Eisenhower Matrix** to prioritize tasks based on urgency and importance.
- Techniques such as *time blocking* and using productivity tools help founders focus and reduce distractions.
- Delegation strategies, including creating SOPs and avoiding micromanagement, free up time for growth.

*Regular schedule audits* and understanding peak energy hours optimize productivity in the long run.

items.title: How ‘Customer Stickiness’ Can Benefit Your Business
items.summary:
*Customer stickiness* measures how well your business becomes integrated into customers' lives through factors like product quality, convenience, and experience.
- It is *proactive*, focusing on delivering consistent value and reducing friction to encourage repeat purchases.
- Improving stickiness can boost *customer loyalty, lifetime value*, and *referrals*, ultimately increasing sales and revenue.

**Scores:** {"scale": 8, "impact": 8, "novelty": 6, "longTermSignificance": 8}
**Keywords:** [Customer Loyalty, Business Growth, Retention, Marketing Metrics, Customer Experience]

items.title: Top Free Accounting Tools for Small Businesses in 2025
items.summary:
- *Several free accounting apps* offer features like invoicing, expense tracking, and bank reconciliation for small businesses.
- *Top tools* include **Wave**, **Zoho Books**, **ZipBooks**, and **GnuCash**, each suited for different needs.
- *Paid free trial options* are available for more advanced features in leading platforms like QuickBooks, Xero, and FreshBooks.

items.title: Founder of Mrs Momma Bear on Underserved Market Niches
items.summary:
- *Lee Evans Lee* founded Mrs Momma Bear to serve women seeking *comfortable, stylish, and functional* clothing.
- She emphasizes *living the problem* and *listening to customer feedback* to identify emotional and practical needs.
- By focusing on unresolved gaps and personal passion, she created a brand that empowers women and fills an underserved market niche.

items.title: Best Restaurant Credit Card Processors
items.summary:
*Explore top restaurant payment processors* suited for various sales models. 
- Key options include **CDGcommerce**, **Helcim**, **Square**, and **Toast**, each offering unique features like *POS integration* and *cash discount programs*. 
- Consider your restaurant’s *hardware, service needs*, and *transaction volume* when choosing a provider; many support online and contactless payments, with customizable plans for growth.
